qas.question: How can it be recovered through steam?

answers.text: use of carbon monoxide through the water gas shift reaction

context:
Consequently, steam reforming typically employs an excess of H
2O. Additional hydrogen can be recovered from the steam by <a0_0>use of carbon monoxide through the water gas shift reaction<a0_0/>, especially with an iron oxide catalyst. This reaction is also a common industrial source of carbon dioxide:
